title: Similar fonts help
content:
Hi !

I'm looking for similar fonts to Walsheim and Planeta Plakat.

Something like this [http://commandogroup.no/info/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/commandogroup.no/info/ "http://commandogroup.no/info/") but with the « a » like Walsheim.

How would you call these types of fonts ? What are good other fonts of that type ?

Thank you.
author: Ju22

comments.content:
Commando Group website uses [P22 Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground-basic). By switching to the [Pro version](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground-pro), you could get the [single storey /a](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground-pro/p22-underground-pro-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/385020/998) available as stylistic alternate through OpenType features.  
More in the same vein: [Brown](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/lineto.com/The%20Fonts/Font%20Categories/Text%20Fonts/Brown), [Fugue](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/fugue), [Relative](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/relative), [Value Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190121/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/value/sans)

Thank you !

Nice suggestions. Very simple, friendly and strong at the same time. Fugue is closest to what I'm looking for...

Any other suggestions ? I'm so obsessed with those.

what kind of serifs would be nice with such geometric sans serifs ?

I saw combinations with slab serifs, I think it looks too similar and misses some « finesse ».
